index01:
This project holds tests for the Skipole WSGI application generator.

Further information about skipole can be found at :
index02:
This project 'skitest' has been created using skipole and illustrates the widgets and functionality produced by skipole.

It is still being developed, and many of the tests and functions have yet to be implemented.
no_javascript_text:
JAVASCRIPT FAILURE

This page is shown because the script on the previous page has failed to run.

This could be due to either a failure in the script, or your browser has javascript disabled.
page.100101.01:
Access to the 'secure1' page should only be allowed once you have input the password 'password1'.

First check that you cannot access the secure1 page, then check that an invalid password fails. Then try 'password1' - and you should be taken directly to secure1. This should set a session cookie into your browser.

Then test that you can subsequently go to the secure1 page without the password, until your browser is closed, and the cookie is lost, or until you have used the logout function in secure1.
page.100101.02:
Similarly, access to the 'secure2' page should only be allowed once you have input the password 'password2' below.

However in this case, rather than a session cookie, a cookie with a one minute expiry time is used instead, so even if the browser is shut down, and re-started, access will still be available to a logged on user if no more than one minute has elapsed.
page.100101.03:
This test uses basic http authentication and if you are not logged in, will open a username/password dialog. This will give access to the secure3 page once you have input any username longer than three characters, and the password of 'password3'.

Please note: this test should work with the Python built-in web server, but may not work with some http servers which may not allow authentication headers through.
page.100102.01: This is the 'secure1' page.  You should only be able to access this page when you have used the password 'password1' in the Test Login page.
page.100102.02:
You can remain logged in and return to the home or login pages using the left navigation buttons. While logged in you will still be able to access this page.

Or you can log out using the button below, which will then deny you access to this page until you again enter the password.
page.100104.01: This is the 'secure2' page.  You should only be able to access this page when you have used the password 'password2' in the Test Login page.
page.100104.02:
You can remain logged in and return to the home or login pages using the left navigation buttons. While logged in you will still be able to access this page.

Or you can log out using the button below, which will then deny you access to this page until you again enter the password.
page.100106.01:
This is the secure3 page - you can see this page once you have input any username longer than three characters, and the password of 'password3'.

This uses basic authentication - and you will stay logged in until your browser is closed, or if your browser implements a time-out.
page.14002.01: A checkbox in a div - but without a form or submit button, typically included within a form. On error, a paragraph above the checkbox will display the error message.
page.14002.02: Submitting the form should give the checkbox result here.
page.14002.03: The button below sets an error into the checkbox and refreshes the page. This causes the textblock to be set to its original unticked state, since these tests are not retaining the state.
page.14002.04: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to ticked.
page.14002.05: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to unticked.
page.14002.06: The following calls a JSON file to set an error into the checkbox.
page.14002.07: The following calls a JSON file to clear a current error condition in the checkbox.
page.14010.01: A span holding a checkbox. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form. Does not display errors.
page.14010.02: Submitting the form should give the checkbox result here.
page.14010.03: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to ticked.
page.14010.04: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to unticked.
page.14020.01:
A div containing a checkbox and text input field. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form.
The text input field is only enabled when the checkbox is checked. Uses javascript and jquery to enable/disable the text input field.
page.14020.02: Submitting the form should give the checkbox result here.
page.14020.03: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to ticked.
page.14020.04: The following calls a JSON file to set the checkbox above to unticked.
page.14101.01:
A table of a single text column, followed by a button link column.
There is a header and title over the text column, the button link can have one get field.
page.14201.01: An ErrorDiv widget is set below this paragraph, normally invisible until an error condition is raised, at which point it will show the error message.
page.14210.01: An ErrorPara widget is set below this paragraph, normally invisible until an error condition is raised, at which point it will show the error message.
page.14220.01:
A div - normally used for modal background containing a div with a paragraph of error text and a clear button with three optional get fields.
The 'clear' button hides the widget without making a call if javascript is available. If not, then the link is called.
page.14230.01:
A div - could be used for modal background containing a div with a paragraph of error text and an X close button with three optional get fields.
The 'X' button hides the widget without making a call if javascript is available. If not, then the link is called.
page.14301.01: A widget containing the current server time. Consists of a span with time stamp.
page.14401.01: A widget of div's containing a paragraph and close button, on the button being pressed, closes without calling the link - but the link is called if javascript disabled. The text changes to the error message on error, and inner div class changes to error_class on error.
page.14410.01: ConfirmBox1: A widget of div's containing a paragraph and two link buttons, The links have options to call either JSON or HTML pages.
page.14420.01: ConfirmBox2: A widget of div's containing a paragraph and two link buttons, The first link auto closes the call if the client has javascript enabled, otherwise it makes the call. The second link targets a html page.
page.14601.01: TextInput1: An input field only, needs to be contained within a form.
page.14610.01: TextInput2: A div containing a hidden error paragraph with a text input field (no form or submit button). A label to the left of the input field can have a class and text set
page.14620.01: TextInput3: A div containing a text input field (no form or submit button) with a left and right label.
page.14630.01: TextInput4: A div containing a div with label and a div with a text input field (no form or submit button).
page.14640.01: Password1: A password input field only (no form, label or submit button), to be embedded in a form.
page.14650.01: Password2: A div containing a hidden error paragraph and password input field (no form or submit button). A label to the left of the field can have a class and text set.
page.14660.01: SubmitTextInput1: A form with error paragraph, input text field, submit button and four hidden fields.
page.14670.01: SubmitTextInput3: A form with error paragraph, two further paragraphs, one with text, one with a TextBlock, an input text field and four hidden fields. The submit button and label follows the input field in its own div.
page.14670.02: This text is set into textblock page.14670.02, it will only be displayed by the SubmitTextInput3 widget if show_para2 is set to True.
page.14680.01: TwoInputsSubmit1: A form with error paragraph, two input text fields, submit button and four hidden fields.
page.14690.01:
SubmitDict1: A  form with a list of input fields followed by a single submit button to allow a client to input a dictionary.
The widget 'input_dict' field is used with an ordered dictionary of keys:values, the keys are embedded in the field names, the values are input text values. On submission input_dict returned is a dictionary with the same keys, and values filled in from the form.
page.14801.01: A widget which can contain further html or widgets. Can provide drag and drop functionality.
page.15001.01: An Unordered List widget containing text strings, these are JSON settable.
page.15101.01: An SVG Chart1 widget containing a list of values, these are JSON settable.
page.15201.01: An SVG defined meter with a measurement value which can be updated by JSON.
page.15203.01: An SVG defined Traditional1 widget. Measurement value can be updated by JSON.
page.210001.01:
Responders are pages which receive a call, and then manipulates the received data in some way, including calling your submit_data function to populate the page_data dictionary.

The responder then generally passes the call to a final template or JSON page which is returned to the client browser.

The following buttons link to tests for each responder type.
page.300001.01: Validators are defined in modules - use the buttons below to the module required.
page.300002.01:
Validators test user input. These are the validators in the basic module.

The links on this page are to input fields, in which validators are used to check various inputs, to confirm they are working correctly.

Generally a validator works both on the client with javascript, and at the server with Python. You should run the tests with javascript both enabled and disabled on your client browser.
page.300003.01: Tests for allowed input which should be 'one', 'two' or 'three' only. Any other value should cause a failure.
page.3001.01: Widgets are defined in modules - use the buttons below to the module required.
page.3002.01: These are the widgets in the checkbox module.
page.3003.01: These are the widgets in the confirm module.
page.3006.01: These are the widgets in the paras module.
page.3007.01: These are the widgets in the links module.
page.3008.01: These are the widgets in the error_messages module.
page.3009.01: These are the widgets in the inputforms module.
page.3010.01: These are the widgets in the inputtext module.
page.3011.01: These are the widgets in the info module.
page.3012.01: Toggle the debug mode to show or hide the ident list at the foot of each page. If debug mode is on, javascript client side validation is disabled.
page.3013.01: These are the widgets in the dropdown module.
page.3014.01:
Currently this module only contains a single widget 'SimpleFooter'.

This is a div containing a further two div's. The first is normally hidden, and will be displayed on error. It contains a paragraph which will show the error message.

The second div contains a paragraph of text displaying text set in the field 'footer_text'.

The SimpleFooter is shown below with widget class set to w3-container
page.3018.01: These are the widgets in the svgmeters module.
page.3025.01: These are the widgets in the lists module.
page.3026.01: These are the widgets in the svggraphs module.
page.410001.01:
The start_call function, GoTo exception and fail page jumps normally jump to a page within their own project, but it is possible they could divert to a sub project.

Tests here explore such diversions, using the lib project, which is always available as a sub-project.
page.500101.01:
This page uses external jquery UI libraries to create ui widgets.

To work correctly you will need an internet connection!

The head section of the page has a script link to jquery-ui.min.js
and a css link to jquery-ui.css

A statement:
page_data['add_jscript'] = """$( "#date" ).datepicker();"""
is then set in the end_call function, which sets the 'date' widget to be a datepicker.
